description: Pichia pastoris is a common micro-organisms used for recombinant proteins production. As an eukrayote it can do more complex post-traductional modifications. It is also known and interesting thanks to its effecient secretory pathway combined to an important production rate of anti-microbial peptides.
genotype: SMD1168H (pep4) is deleted from protease A effects.
growth:
Pichia pastoris can grow on different medium. Most of time, methanol is used to induce production through the methanol-dependant-promotor AOX1 commonly used in protein production.
It growths rate is slower than common bacteria.
transformation_protocols: Condensed protocol for competent cell preparation and transformation of the methylotrophic yeast Pichia pastoris.
